snippet: Senators confirmed over Republican objections Sarah Saldaña as director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement and Antony Blinken to be deputy secretary of state.
abstract: United States Senate confirms federal prosecutor Sarah Saldana as director of the United States Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency and former national security adviser Antony Blinken to be deputy secretary of state; Senate has confirmed 41 of Pres Obama's nominees with less than 60 votes, rule changed when filibuster was abolished for all but Supreme Court nominations.
lead_paragraph: Senators confirmed over Republican objections Sarah Saldaña as director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement and Antony Blinken to be deputy secretary of state.

headline.main: With the Way Eased, Two More Obama Nominees Win Approval From the Senate
headline.print_headline: With the Way Eased, Two More Obama Nominees Win Approval From Senate
